positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.description:
I'm a member of the Drivers team. We build the open source libraries that enable users of all programming languages to use MongoDB in their applications.

I am the lead developer of MongoSwift, the official MongoDB Swift driver. The driver provides an idiomatic MongoDB API for Swift applications running on iOS, tvOS, watchOS, MacOS, and Linux, and works with both traditional and embedded MongoDB (i.e. MongoDB Mobile). I wrote the driver from scratch with the oversight of a lead engineer and continue to maintain it and add new features along with two teammates. Please see the GitHub repo and documentation linked below for more information.

I serve as a mentor to more junior engineers and interns, and speak about Swift and MongoDB at technical conferences.
…
see more

positions.title: Teaching Assistant
positions.description: I was a teaching assistant for 6.00, Introduction to Computer Science and Programming in Python. My responsibilities included teaching weekly recitations to ~20 students, writing and editing problem sets and exams, supervising office hours, grading, and communicating with students via email and the class Piazza forum.

positions.title: Software Engineering Intern
positions.description:
I worked with the Cloud Automation team on the automation agent software, used in MongoDB's Atlas, Ops Manager, and Cloud Manager services.

The automation agent is written primarily in Go. It automates the server configuration for monitored MongoDB deployments and deploying changes when requested.

My work involved adding additional capabilities to the agent -- for example, the ability to perform a "rolling restart" - i.e. restart each server in a cluster in turn with no loss of data availability.

positions.title: Lab Assistant
positions.description:
I helped to teach various introductory classes as a lab assistant for 6.149 - Introduction to Python, 6.01 - Introduction to Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, and 6.0001/6.0002 - Introduction to Computer Science and Programming in Python.

My responsibilities included assisting students in lab sections, giving “check-offs” (orally testing students on their mastery of material), proofreading and providing feedback on future assignments, grading problem sets and exams, and working with students in office hours.

positions.title: Intern Software Analyst and Developer
positions.description: As a member of the Developer Services team, I created internal web applications to improve developers’ interactions with the company’s continuous integration server. I integrated APIs from Amazon Web Services and Jenkins CI, and implemented a transformation to present detailed test results in an HTML report.

positions.title: Systems and Analysis Group Intern
positions.description: I developed a rapid aircraft infrared signature generation tool in MATLAB to provide signature data to the lab’s production code ~5x times faster than the previous model. I also designed and implemented validation software to verify accuracy of the data produced by the tool.
